thread.title: Former San Diego players, coach in hot water
thread.title_full: Former San Diego players, coach in hot water - NY Daily News

author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Former San Diego players, coach in hot water
text:
Ignelzi/AP Brandon Johnson (l.) and Brandon Dowdy (below) are named in a federal indictment that charges individuals with running a gambling ring that affects the outcomes of games. Two former University of San Diego basketball players - one the program's all-time leader in points and assists - and a former assistant coach are at the center of an ugly betting scandal, federal authorities announced Monday.
Brandon Johnson , the star player, Brandon Dowdy , former coach Thaddeus Brown and seven other people were named in a federal indictment that charges the individuals with running an elaborate gambling ring that affected the outcomes of games.
Among the claims are that the 24-year-old Johnson took a bribe to influence a February 2010 USD game and that Brown and Dowdy solicited another party to affect the outcome of a game at the University of California, Riverside in February. A federal grand jury handed up the indictment in San Diego Friday. It was unsealed Monday.
Avery/AP Brandon Johnson (l.) and Brandon Dowdy (below) are named in a federal indictment that charges individuals with running a gambling ring that affects the outcomes of games. "They are rightly concerned," U.S. Attorney Laura Duffy said at a press conference, alluding to USD school officials who met with Duffy and FBI Agent Keith Slotter . "They were very responsive and cooperative and it was a good meeting."
The case is reminiscent of the betting scandal that enveloped Boston College in the mid-'90s, when former Giants quarterback Tim Hasselbeck was a member of the Eagles' roster. Thirteen BC players were suspended for gambling infractions.
Brandon Johnson (l.) and Brandon Dowdy (below) are named in a federal indictment that charges individuals with running a gambling ring that affects the outcomes of games. But the USD matter evolved from an FBI investigation into a marijuana distribution ring. Among the other charges are conspiracy to commit sports bribery and marijuana distribution. Johnson, 24, played at USD from 2005-2010 and finished with 1,790 points and 525 assists.
